page.title: 20Morwenstow childrens's poems
page.content:
A Saxon font stands in the church A pelican looks down from her perch, Light shines in from the windows tall, Morwenna's fresco is on the wall, Stained glass tells of days gone by As we sit and worship God most high {David Cleave aged 11
Our school is built of local stone With slates from Delabole Our school is built on top of a hill And is very very old The roof is steep, the walls are white With wooden window frames, And round our school are grassy fields And steeply sided lanes. {Petra Frreman aged 10
Our school was built in the form of a cross,For Reverend Hawker was the boss {Kingsley Bryant aged 10 {"Poems for the Parson" St Mark's 1975
